text:
Hey everyone, hope you are doing good!
My customer wants to sync HubSpot tickets to their own custom system and I was wondering if they could use <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/tickets|the Ticket API> of the developer documentation.
Would that be the right way or would you choose an other approach?
I have tried, but I can only find either the contact or the associated company and never both at the same time.
yes <@U02K79G4BC3> they should use the ticket api to keep sync HubSpot tickets with their own custom system.
<@UKGV272KS> do you know by chance if we can subscribe a contact to an inactive subscription type by API?
I don't, sorry! I would think it's unlikely though, as a contact cannot subscribe on the subscription page if it's not there.
any chance serverless functions don't work properly if you are using a page preview? Everything seems to work on the dev version but when I move to production it throws an error
is the "secret" (in my case a private app access code) available in the production environment when I add it using the CLI?
ok, I think that's the issue, the secret is not available in the production environment
but when I try to add it I get `[ERROR] The secret "my_secret_code" was not added`
Hey HubSpot-Gurus, does anyone know by chance if you can subscribe a contact via the subscription API to an *inactive* subscription type?
that's actually what I was thinking as well, thanks for sharing your thoughts
Do you know if we have to keep any limits in regards of amounts of syncs in mind?
<@U01E6Q1958A> <@U02JH23B6T1> - did anyone ever solve this issue? I'm trying to see which event(s) certain contacts are members / subscribers of and it seems based on this thread that isn't possible?
